Comment: By many accounts, Hilliard, a leafy suburb west of downtown Columbus, is a midwestern success story:      Its progressive school district gives a vacation day for all students to mark the Muslim holiday of Eid al-Fitr ‚Äì the first in Ohio to do so ‚Äì and its homes are highly sought-after by a growing number of diverse families where locals enjoy shopping at the oldest Asian grocery in the state.  But it is also where Christopher Brenner Cook, a convicted terrorist, grew up. In April 2023, Cook and two others were sentenced for conspiring to attack America‚Äôs electrical grid, and he was given a 92-month prison term.  Cook, who was 21 at the time of his sentencing for conspiring to blow up electricity stations, was previously a devout white supremacist who tried to recruit people to the neo-Nazi cause. He focused specifically on children in an effort to avoid detection by law enforcement.  More than 3,780 miles away in Derbyshire, England, 14-year-old Rhianan Rudd encountered Cook on WhatsApp and Discord, the online chat app. As of September 2020, the BBC noted she had been in contact with Cook ‚Äúfor some time‚Äù. By early 2021, Rudd ‚Äì who was autistic and had a history of self-harm ‚Äì was spending up to 15 hours a day speaking to Cook online.  Cook had been grooming, sexually abusing and radicalizing Rudd. The last time she had contact with Cook, he told her he loved her, and she felt a ‚Äúgaping hole‚Äù and ‚Äúvery sad for a long time‚Äù.  In May 2022, aged 16, Rhianan killed herself.  ‚è¨ Bluesky 'bite-sized' article thread (15 min) with extra links üìñüçøüîä  [https://bsky.app/profile/johnhatchard.bsky.social/post/3lojmhgnb5d2m](https://bsky.app/profile/johnhatchard.bsky.social/post/3lojmhgnb5d2m)

They seem to love the idea of authoritarianism as long as it hursts people they don‚Äôt like. I love Lexington, I will never live in Ohio again.

Comment: Are we related by any chance? I have a genealogy hobby and some branches of my paternal family have lived there for like at least a couple of centuries or so. My dad and his siblings were all born there and he's the only one who got out of there while both of my paternal grandparents lived and died there but to my knowledge they weren't racist (I actually had a wonderful relationship with my paternal grandma before she passed away in 2023, she literally was my favorite grandmother).  I personally haven't set foot in Ohio in eons (I must have been REAL little the last time I went there in person) but from the things I have heard about it from the people who have been over there it doesn't seem like I'm missing much. The only reason I would consider going there to begin with is to see the graves of my dad (he passed away in 2020) and my grandparents because of how much I loved my dad and grandma in particular and I was named after my grandpa, but from where I live that would require an airplane and probably way more money than I have right now. I just feel like such a bad daughter and granddaughter because of this especially as I love them so much but I believe that all of them are all still with me anyway.  This came out longer than I originally thought!
Author: bakerfredricka
